medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain from bilaterally enlarged ovaries.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began over the past 2 years, with progressive ovarian enlargement and worsening abdominal pain. Despite long-term GnRH analogue therapy, which successfully decreased gonadotropin-dependent steroidogenesis, the abdominal pain persisted and worsened due to increasing ovarian sizes, eventually necessitating bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) with hyperandrogenism, severe insulin resistance from metabolic syndrome, nonalcoholic steatohepatitis, pulmonary embolism while taking oral contraceptives, hepatotoxicity from metformin and spironolactone therapies, laparoscopic surgeries for left ovarian serous cystadenoma and cholecystectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents had diabetes; a twin sister had PCOS.
